label: [.core] support JS hash naming in variable access
info: ## Hash naming Javascript supports array-like access to object variables: ``` key.key2["key-three-minus"] ``` which is the equivalent to ``` key.key2.key-three-minus ``` But since `-` is not allowed in variable names nor in keynames when using dot-notation, JS invented the array-like accessing of keynames with minus and other special characters. Since objects attributes can definitely contain minus & spaces & all sorts. ## Workaround Until this is implemented, the function 2 node provides a workaround by using Erlang code to access the map data directly.

name: handle a mix of atom and binary key names
retrieve schema & host
func:
Msg2 = ered_header_retrieve:get_key(<<"x-forwarded-proto">>, schema, Msg),
ered_header_retrieve:get_key(<<"host">>, host, Msg2)

code:
-module(ered_header_retrieve).

-export([get_key/3]).

get_key(Keyname, AttrName, Msg) ->
    case maps:find(req, Msg) of
    {ok, D} ->
        case maps:find(headers, D) of 
            {ok, H} ->
                case maps:find(Keyname,H) of  
                    {ok, S} ->
                        maps:put(AttrName, S, Msg);
                    _ -> 
                        Msg
                end;
            _ ->
                Msg
            end;
        _ ->
        Msg
    end.
